about_the_game:
RADIOSOL

is a journey through a desolate world burned by a planetary cataclysm. In search of answers, you will have to navigate through the ruins of megastructures and abandoned cities, avoiding the scorching rays of the Sun.

-Why do my eyes hurt so much?

Only concrete mountains block the Sun. It hurts my eyes so much. Night used to fall quickly in these man-made valleys. But not now.
When did this stop?

-Why can’t I hear other people’s voices?

I am the world's ear. I hear every radio station. I hear the hum of transistors, the boiling of mercury, and every rock on the visible side of the moon. But people don't talk anymore.
When did this stop?

-Why do I have so many limbs?

sagging - contraction - lengthening - emphasis
sagging - contraction - lengthening - emphasis
sagging - contraction - lengthening - emphasis
The Grove will be burned. Will I burn it?

content_descriptors.notes: This Game may contain content not appropriate for all ages, or may not be appropriate for viewing at work: Violence or Gore, General Mature Content.

name: RADIOSOL

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel(R) Xeon(R) CPU E5-2680 v3 @ 2.50GHz
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1060
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 1 GB available space
  • Sound Card: Yes
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Windows 11
  • Processor: 11th Gen Intel(R) Core i7-11800H @ 2.30GHz
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 1 GB available space
  • Sound Card: Yes
